intro: Enchysia gaudichaudii, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Pandanaceae and is characterized by its strap-like, fibrous leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its roots and leaves have been traditionally used by Māori for making ropes, mats, and other woven items. Enchysia gaudichaudii thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
